thread.title: Top 10 Blue Jays playoff moments ... so far
thread.title_full: Top 10 Blue Jays playoff moments ... so far

title: Top 10 Blue Jays playoff moments ... so far
text:
Whatever happens in Game 6 of the American League Championship Series Friday night in Kansas City, Mo., the Toronto Blue Jays have produced memorable moment after memorable moment in October. 
Some – like Jose Bautista's bomb in the ALDS – will give you chills. 
Others – like the idiots bombarding fans with full cans of beer – were a stain on the best Blue Jays season in more than 20 years. 
Ahead of Friday night's win-or-go-home game at The K, here are our most memorable moments of the Jays playoff run – so far... 
BAUTISTA'S BAT FLIP 
It's a moment that will be played back for, well, maybe forever. Bautista's monster home run to break Game 5 open – and eventually sink the Texas Rangers – was stuff of legends. 
BENCHES CLEAR 
Needless to say, the Rangers didn't appreciate – throughout the entire ALDS, actually – the Blue Jays showboating. Benches cleared after Bautista stared down Rangers pitcher Sam Dyson following the aforementioned home run, finishing out a crazy seventh inning that began with one of the most controversial moments in ALDS history. 
GAME UNDER 'PROTEST' 
Ahead of Bautista's homer and benches clearing, Game 5 of the ALDS was stirred up after catcher Russell Martin's attempted toss back to the mound deflected off Shin-Shoo Choos bad, allowing a Rangers runner to score from third. Upon review, the run was allowed, sparking rage in the bleachers. 
FULL BEERS FLY 
There was a massive delay following the Shin-Shoo Choo incident when Jays fans decided to bombard the diamond with full- and half-empty beer cans. Some women and children headed for the exits after being struck by projectiles while sitting in high-priced seats next to the field. That prompted the Jays to issue a beer can ban on unruly fans sitting in the nosebleeds for the rest of the postseason. 
JAYS ADVANCE 
There's nothing like the final pitch in a series win. Check out Roberto Osuna's reaction following the strikeout that wrapped up Toronto's first playoff series win in 22 years. 
CRACK MAYOR 
Rob Ford: The gift that keeps on giving. Fans in Kansas City welcomed the Jays for ALCS Games 1 and 2 by taking a shot at Toronto's former mayor. ICYMI: Last time in KC, a Royals fan took a shot at Rob Ford pic.twitter.com/58yXJasha5 — Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) October 23, 2015 
THE MISTAKE 
With the Blue Jays seemingly in control of Game 2 – and hoping to head back to Rogers Centre with a 1-1 series split – an egregious mistake from second baseman Ryan Goins in the seventh inning saw the Royals rally to claim a 2-0 series lead. — SLAM! Sports (@SlamSports) October 23, 2015 
POSITION PLAYER PITCHING 
It's one of those records you want to avoid claiming in the playoffs. The Blue Jays became the first team in MLB history to allow an every day position player to pitch in a playoff game after the Royals roughed up R.A. Dickey – and the rest of the Jays pitching staff – in Game 4. 
PILLAR BEING PILLAR 
Here's just a spectacular catch from Jays centre-field Kevin Pillar to kick off Game 3 of the ALCS. 
LIBRARY BROUHAHA 
After the Kansas City Public Library used "book spine poetry" to take a shot at the Blue Jays, the Toronto Public Library answered when the Jays claimed two of three games at Rogers Centre to cut the series lead to 3-2. 
Our friends at Kansas City Public Library shared some book spine poetry with us this morning (http://ow.ly/TGJxS ) but we've got a way with words too. #ComeTOgether #GoJaysGo
